text: Estanislao Valdés Otero (born 18 August 1931 in Montevideo)Profile of Estanislao Valdés Otero is a Uruguayan lawyer, author, and politician. During the Civic-military dictatorship of Uruguay he was Minister of Agriculture and Fisheries (2 February 1977 – 14 April 1978) and afterwards Minister of Foreign Relations (17 February 1981 – 2 September 1982). He was in charge of keeping Uruguay neutral during the Falklands War. ==Works== * Derechos de autor: régimen jurídico uruguayo. Prologue by Eduardo J. Couture (Facultad de Derecho, Montevideo, 1953).Derechos de autor * Inflación y subdesarrollo (Fundación de Cultura Universitaria, 1992).Inflación y subdesarrollo ==References== Category:1931 births Category:Living people Category:People from Montevideo Category:University of the Republic (Uruguay) alumni Category:Uruguayan lawyers Category:Civic-military dictatorship of Uruguay Category:Ministers of Livestock, Agriculture, and Fisheries of Uruguay Category:Foreign ministers of Uruguay
title: Estanislao Valdés Otero
